abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the GEF-Western Indian
            Ocean Marine Highway Development and Coastal and Marine
            Contamination Prevention Project for Africa is to increase
            the safety and efficiency of navigation. Project
            implementation and achievement of development objectives are
            currently rated as satisfactory.  The project closing date
            was extended to December 31, 2011 after the mid-term review
            (November 2010).  Both implementation agencies South African
            Maritime Safety Authority (SAMSA) and Indian Ocean
            Commission (IOC) are performing satisfactorily.  The
            project's audit reports for both implementation
            agencies for 2010 have been submitted; SAMSA's audit
            report is satisfactory, and IOC's audit report is
            acceptable but some comments were forwarded requesting IOC
            to work with the auditor's to revise the report and
            ensure full compliance with our requirements.  The project
            objectives are achievable. The reallocation is necessary to
            reflect: (i) the longer project period considering the
            extension of the closing date to Dec. 31, 2012, already
            approved (ii) actual costs of the various works, goods and
            consulting services under the project, and (iii) larger than
            anticipated in-kind contributions from the various
            participating states and organizations.
